title: How to Make Edible Cookie Dough

steps.headline: Place the butter in a large cooking bowl and add the sugar.
steps.description: Cream together with a fork until you get a smooth texture. Add vanilla.

steps.headline: Sieve the flour and pinch of salt into the mix and stir again until the mix is as thick and sturdy as possible.
Eat the cookie dough as it is.
steps.description: Enjoy! Or keep going and make them into cookies.

steps.headline: Follow Steps 1 and 2 for standard dough above.
When sieving in the flour, add the cocoa powder.
Mix in the chocolate chips for taste.

methods.name: Low fat cookie dough in seconds

steps.headline: Mix the butter, sugar, and milk together.
steps.description: If you want very dry and crackly dough, do not add milk. For results that look like dough or thick paste, add milk.

steps.headline: When done, take another bowl and mix the vanilla and flour into a big ball.
Mash the two balls together until it forms one big ball.
Keep rolling and mashing until it becomes a very thick paste.
steps.description: It is now ready to eat.

steps.headline: To make into a cookie, add 3 tablespoons of sugar, chocolate chips and sprinkles (optional) and 1 tablespoon of milk.
steps.description: Bake for 17-20 minutes or until golden brown and crispy.

text: Standard Dough Place the butter in a large cooking bowl and add the sugar. Cream together with a fork until you get a smooth texture. Add vanilla. Sieve the flour and pinch of salt into the mix and stir again until the mix is as thick and sturdy as possible.  Eat the cookie dough as it is. Enjoy! Or keep going and make them into cookies. Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Follow Steps 1 and 2 for standard dough above.  When sieving in the flour, add the cocoa powder.  Mix in the chocolate chips for taste.  Finished.  Low fat cookie dough in seconds Mix the butter, sugar, and milk together. If you want very dry and crackly dough, do not add milk. For results that look like dough or thick paste, add milk. Roll into a ball.  When done, take another bowl and mix the vanilla and flour into a big ball.  Mash the two balls together until it forms one big ball.  Keep rolling and mashing until it becomes a very thick paste. It is now ready to eat. To make into a cookie, add 3 tablespoons of sugar, chocolate chips and sprinkles (optional) and 1 tablespoon of milk. Bake for 17-20 minutes or until golden brown and crispy. Finished.
